Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: So many. The skill to revisit work again and again. The ability to learn independently + ask for help when needed. The ability to work around my own limitations to create work. The ability to receive feedback and extract what's most valuable from multiple points of view.
There are various projects to work on allowing for various iterations and a natural create, discuss, edit process. The critiques are always insightful and constructive.

The course is a little early and a little long, but that's no means fault of the professor. I wish in addition to critique, we could have had chats/lectures on best practices + foundations. Alternatively, hands on, in class assignments would also be really helpful. For instance, I found the bookbinding demo incredibly helpful, as well as the NY times assignment that we got to start in class. In addition to looking at a lot of books, could we go further into a piece of work and deconstruct it to really understand the choices being made and how they work to make a cohesive whole?
Yes, especially if you are looking to further your understanding of how to create cohesive systems of typographic-minded work.
